52 |reps = 242 |delegates = 3 |s-majority = Whig |h-majority = Whig }} The 'Twenty-
seventh United States Congress' was a meeting of the legislative branch of the
United States federal government, consisting of the United States Senate and the
United States House of Representatives. It met in Washington, D.C. from March 4,
1841 to March 4, 1843, during the one-month administration of U.S. President
William Henry Harrison and the first two years of the administration of his
successor, John Tyler. The apportionment of seats in the House of
Representatives was based on the Fifth Census of the United States in 1830. Both
chambers had a Whig majority.
